text: i'm the founder and ceo of a startup
called janacare
that's working on making diabetes
management simpler and cheaper in
developing countries
diabetes has become a major public
health issue in
the developing world now to give you
numbers
india alone has four times as many
diabetics as the united states
it's an expensive disease and it's
expensive because not only does it
have direct costs of managing your
condition taking your medicines on time
and so on but also indirectly it can
lead to a lot of other conditions
so what we are developing is a mobile
phone attachment that will basically
allow patients to
test their vital signs like their blood
sugar their activity their heart rate
on a regular basis and we think that
this technology can basically allow
patients to not only test
you know more often but also bring about
sustainable lifestyle changes
